_exec_summary.SummaryText: 1.  Facility Information.  The Owner, Management and Employees of Wymore Fertilizer Company are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the faciclity is prepared to work with the local fire department, County Lepc, and/or other authorities, to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.                                                                                                                                          2.  Facility information.  The primary activity at the facility is the distribution of products to farmets.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia, is received, stored, and dsitributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  Anyhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for that purpose.                                                                                                         3.  Accident Release Prevention Program.  The facility follows the provisions of the U. S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our State Regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.                                                                                                                                                        4.  Five Year Accident History.   There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia during the past five years that have caused any deaths, injuries, or significant property damage at the facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any acccidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, propertydamang, or environmental damage.                   5.  Emergency Response Program.  The facility has an emergency action plan.  We do not plan to have our employees respond to a majr release.  Of a large release of anhydrous ammonia takes place at our facility, the response action is to evacuate th

e area of the release and call 911 and all applicable emergenty response numbers.                                                                  6.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety.  Safety improvement is an ongoing process at this facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions at the facility.  At this time there are no major changes planned for our safety program.
